New Records: India recorded its highest PowerPlay score in T20 World Cup 2024
Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya's 27-ball half-century helped India reach 196/5
Shivam Dube was dismissed for 34 off 24 balls
Rishabh Pant was dismissed for 36 off 24 balls
Virat Kohli was dismissed for 37 off 28 balls
Rohit Sharma was dismissed for 23 off 11 balls
Suryakumar Yadav was dismissed for a two-ball six
India won the match by 50 runs
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and opted to bowl first
India's batting coach Vikram Rathour said the silver lining of Virat Kohli's early fall has been the middle order stepping up
Post-Match Reflections: India moved closer to the semifinals with the win
India's victory meant they would qualify for the semifinals if Australia beat Afghanistan on Sunday
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua
India's highest score at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua was 196/5
The highest score at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua was South Africa's 194/4 against USA in 2024
Others: The match was broadcast live on the Star Sports Network in India and streamed on Disney+ Hotstar
The Super Eight Group 1 points table was updated after the match, with India going top of the group
